title: Deliverance from Enemies
shortSummary: Psalm 59 is a heartfelt prayer of David seeking God's protection from his enemies who seek to kill him unjustly. It expresses trust in God's power and mercy, affirming that God is the ultimate defender and refuge in times of trouble.
timeline: c. 1020 BC - During the reign of King Saul, when Saul sent men to watch David's house to kill him

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and future king of Israel, who is under threat from Saul and prays for God's deliverance.

keyCharacters.name: Saul
keyCharacters.description: The first king of Israel who, out of jealousy, sent men to watch David’s house to kill him.

A title for God emphasizing His sovereign command over heavenly armies and all earthly powers.

outline.heading: David’s Plea for Deliverance
outline.description: David urgently calls on God to rescue him from his enemies who seek to kill him without cause, appealing to God's justice and power to defend His people.

outline.heading: Description of the Enemy’s Threat
outline.description: David describes his enemies as relentless and vicious, comparing their behavior to barking dogs, yet he confidently declares that God will mock and deride them.

outline.heading: David’s Confidence in God’s Protection
outline.description: David expresses his trust in God's strength and mercy, asking God to scatter the enemies by His power rather than slay them outright, so that God’s sovereignty will be recognized.

outline.heading: The Enemies’ Futile Pursuit
outline.description: The psalmist repeats the imagery of the enemies prowling like dogs, restless and unsatisfied, emphasizing their fruitless efforts against God’s chosen.

outline.heading: Praise for God’s Defense and Mercy
outline.description: David concludes with a vow to sing of God’s power and mercy, acknowledging God as his refuge and strength in times of trouble.

application: Trust God as your defender in times of unjust opposition and pray earnestly for His protection.
Remember to praise God for His mercy and strength even amid trials and threats.
Avoid seeking personal vengeance; instead, rely on God’s righteous judgment to deal with enemies.
Maintain confidence that God’s sovereignty extends over all circumstances, giving believers hope and peace.

keyVerses.text: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
keyVerses.significance: This opening verse captures the psalm’s central theme of seeking God’s protection against hostile forces.

keyVerses.text: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
keyVerses.significance: David’s declaration of trust in God’s strength encourages believers to patiently rely on God’s protection.

keyVerses.text: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God’s ultimate authority over all nations and His righteous judgment against the wicked.

keyVerses.text: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
keyVerses.significance: David’s commitment to praise God highlights the importance of worshiping God for His deliverance.
